intro: Mapania macrantha subsp. ivorensis, commonly known as the Ivorian mapania, is a flowering plant native to western Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and for horticultural purposes.
